title: Ceramic Techniques and Inspiration Journal
Basic Techniques for Pottery Pinching and Sculpting: A Memo
content:
I. Coil Building Method:  
1. The clay coils should be uniform in thickness.  
2. During coiling, the joints must be fully bonded and smoothed.  

II. Slab Building Method:  
1. The rolled clay slabs should have a consistent thickness.  
2. Reinforcement is required at the corners where slabs are joined.  

III. Goal for the Next Class:  
Attempt to independently complete a simple pen holder.
summarized_info:
Yu Xiaowen recorded the basic techniques of pottery pinching and molding for reference. The content includes:  
I. Coil Building Method:  
1. The clay coils should be of uniform thickness.  
2. During the building process, the joints must be fully bonded and smoothed.  

II. Slab Construction Method:  
1. The rolled clay slabs should have a consistent thickness.  
2. Reinforcement is required at the corners where slabs are joined.  

III. Goal for the Next Lesson:

title: Key Points of English Literature on HFpEF Management Strategies
content:
I. Key Points:  
1. Diagnosis of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction requires a combination of clinical symptoms, biomarkers, and imaging.  
2. Treatment emphasizes the management of comorbidities, particularly hypertension and atrial fibrillation.  
3. SGLT2 inhibitors have demonstrated benefits in the treatment of HFpEF.  

II. Personal Learning Points:  
1. Strengthening relevant English terminology is necessary.  
2. Seeking guidance from Teacher Li Wei on specific applications in clinical practice is advisable.
summarized_info:
Yu Xiaowen recorded the key learning points from English literature on the latest management strategies for HFpEF. The content includes:  
I. Core Perspectives:  
1. Diagnosis of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction requires a combination of clinical symptoms, biomarkers, and imaging.  
2. Treatment emphasizes the management of comorbidities, particularly hypertension and atrial fibrillation.  
3. SGLT2 inhibitors have shown benefits in the treatment of HFpEF.  
II. Personal Learning Points:

2. Can consult Teacher Li Wei for specific applications in clinical practice.

title: Notes on Learning Basic Pottery Techniques
content:
I. Basic Pinching Techniques:  
1. Kneading Clay: Thoroughly remove air to ensure the clay is uniform and free of bubbles.  
2. Hand-Pinching Shaping: Start from the base and gradually shape upward, maintaining even thickness.  

II. Recent Practice Goals:  
1. Complete a simple ceramic bowl.  
2. Attempt to add simple incised patterns to the rim of the bowl.  

III. Inspiration Source: Draw inspiration from the minimalist lines and natural textures in Master Zheng's works.

title: Review of Key Points for Handling Emergency Situations During Night Shifts
content:
I. Night Shift on January 8: Patient Zhang (Bed 3) complained of sudden dizziness and nausea, with blood pressure measured at 192/112 mmHg. After consulting Dr. Li Wei, sublingual antihypertensive medication was administered, an intravenous line was established, and cardiac monitoring was initiated. Blood pressure was controlled, and symptoms alleviated approximately 50 minutes later.

II. Night Shift on January 9: Patient Li (Bed 8) complained of palpitations, shortness of breath, and a sense of impending doom, suspected to be an acute anxiety attack. On-site reassurance was provided, vital signs were assessed as stable, psychological counseling was conducted, and a small dose of sedative medication was administered as per temporary medical orders. The patient's emotional state gradually stabilized after about half an hour.

III. Reflections:  
1. During night shift handovers, greater attention should be paid to high-risk patients with underlying conditions or emotional instability.  
2. The timing and methods of communication with family members can be further optimized.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen reviewed in her notes the two emergency situations handled during night shifts in January, involving two different patients.

title: Reflections on Strolling Along the Kaifeng City Wall
content: August 20, 2025, I took a walk and chatted with Zhang Jing on the ancient city wall of Kaifeng. We walked for a long time and talked for a long time, enjoying the scenery and looking at the bricks beneath our feet. We talked about work, and I felt like a spinning top that never stops—the intensity of the residency rotations is overwhelming, leaving both my body and mind exhausted. There’s also that crucial exam at the end of the year, and my review progress is never quite satisfactory, leaving me feeling uncertain. Thankfully, Jing listened to me patiently and offered a lot of encouragement. The city wall and our shadows under the sunset were truly beautiful. I hope everything will slowly get better.

Perhaps it could be expressed in a more emotional way.

title: Evening Relaxation Ritual
content:
April 4, 2025, evening. After my duty shift, my thoughts are in disarray.  
1. Brew a calming herbal tea while playing Bach’s "Air on the G String" through the speakers, letting the music help settle my mind.  
2. Focus on pottery for about an hour, letting my hands follow the clay and my heart find stillness with the music.  
3. Engage in 25 minutes of shoulder and neck stretches, allowing my body to relax as well.  
4. Read *Better: A Surgeon’s Notes on Performance* for 40 minutes and note today’s keywords: Qingming duty shift, comfort from family, weighing friendships.  
Core: When plans (like sharing a rental) change, returning to these self-crafted rituals helps quickly regain inner peace and a sense of control. Bach’s music served as an excellent guide tonight.
summarized_info: I documented my evening relaxation ritual, which includes listening to Bach's "Air on the G String," doing pottery, stretching, and reading.

title: Rethinking the Restart of the Exercise Plan
content: 2.22 The body feels like it's recovering well, and the evening walks are quite comfortable. Restarting exercise shouldn't be rushed—begin with short, low-intensity activities like walking, focusing on paying attention to the body's feedback and stopping if discomfort arises. Later, you can try running in the evenings or alternating with playing badminton on weekends. The goal for now is to aim for two to three moderate-intensity activities per week.
summarized_info: In my notes, I recorded reflections on resuming exercise after recovering from illness, emphasizing starting with short, low-intensity activities, paying attention to bodily sensations, and planning to alternate between running and badminton, with a goal of engaging in moderate-intensity activities 2-3 times per week.

title: November 5th Mood Journal
content: I was deeply saddened to hear the tragic news about a colleague at noon today. I couldn’t fall asleep during the lunch break at all. I kept thinking about our work situation and felt terrified. Later, I called someone close to me and talked for over forty minutes, pouring out everything that had been weighing on my heart. I felt much better afterward—it really helps to talk to someone. Music and games don’t seem to truly relieve this kind of emotion. I must remember not to keep things bottled up the next time I’m under pressure.
summarized_info: It documented feeling immense pressure and fear upon hearing the unfortunate news about a colleague, which was alleviated through long conversations with close ones, reflecting that social venting is more effective than music or games.

title: Quietly's Cat Care Tips & Mood Journal
content:
July 30, 2025 Reflection

Insights from chatting with Jingjing at Nanqiang Café:
1. About Meiqiu: Jingjing said it's normal for a new cat to feel anxious when arriving home—her cat Mimi was the same way. She suggested I could prepare a few more cardboard boxes for Meiqiu to explore, which would help increase his sense of security.
2. About myself: She said I’m taking good care of Meiqiu and shouldn’t be too hard on myself. Being able to share these trivial yet sweet worries with her is already a form of release in itself.

I’m truly grateful to have such a friend who always listens when I need it and offers advice that hits the mark. Every time we talk, it feels like a big weight is lifted off my chest.
summarized_info: In my notes, I recorded the cat care advice given by my close friend Zhang Jing during our gathering at the café, and expressed my gratitude towards her, believing that her listening and suggestions have been a great help to me.

title: Cooking Insights
content:
February 11th, Summary of Attempting Cola Chicken Wings:
1. Outcome: The flavor was acceptable, but the heat was a bit too high during the reduction of the sauce, resulting in some wings being darker in color and slightly bitter.
2. Progress: There was improvement compared to the last time I made fish-flavored shredded pork—at least it was edible this time.
3. Reflection: More precise control of heat and timing is needed. When following a recipe, I shouldn’t rush through it.
4. Related Thoughts: The last time (February 4th) I went to the spicy soup restaurant was because the failed fish-flavored shredded pork left me with a bit of a kitchen phobia. However, after a few days of rest, I still wanted to give it another try. Cooking truly is a skill that requires patient practice.
summarized_info: Recorded reflections on the attempt to cook cola chicken wings on February 11th, and linked it with a reflective analysis of the reasons for dining out on February 4th.

title: Self-Reminders During Market Volatility
content: When I saw the fund plummeting sharply, my first reaction was panic and the urge to sell. After taking a deep breath, I revisited a previously saved financial article titled "The Discipline of Long-Term Investing Amid Market Volatility." I reminded myself: 1) Short-term market noise should not affect long-term planning; 2) Emotional trading is the primary enemy of returns; 3) Stick to regular investments and avoid giving up during downturns. In the end, I refrained from taking any action.
summarized_info: It documented how, during a market downturn and fund drawdown, the impulse to sell was restrained. Emotions were stabilized by revisiting investment principles, ultimately leading to the decision to adhere to the original investment plan without making any trades.

title: Memorandum for Tomato and Egg Noodle Recipe
content: February 11, 2025. Had no appetite due to a cold, so my mom taught me how to make this remotely, and I finally learned it. Key steps: 1. Score a cross on the tomatoes, blanch them in boiling water to remove the skin, then cut them into pieces. 2. Beat the eggs, heat oil in a pan, scramble the eggs until cooked, and set aside. 3. Add more oil to the pan, stir-fry the tomatoes until they release their juices, then add water and bring to a boil. 4. Add noodles, and just before they're done, add the scrambled eggs and salt. Tasted pretty good—will try making it on my own next time.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen documented the process and insights of learning to make tomato and egg noodles under the remote guidance of her mother while she had a cold.

title: 07.22 Outpatient Conflict Incident Review and Reflection
content:
This morning’s communication conflict with the patient’s family during the outpatient session has been reported as an adverse event in the system. Areas for reflection:  
1. **Communication**: The initial explanation was overly technical and failed to use more relatable language to help the family understand the necessity of the examination, leading to an escalation of misunderstandings. In the future, simpler explanations should be prepared.  
2. **Emotional Management**: At the onset of the questioning, feelings of frustration and irritation arose internally, but deep breathing was used to maintain outward professionalism and composure, avoiding direct confrontation with the family. This aspect was handled adequately.  
3. **Emergency Response**: During the deadlock, the conversation was promptly paused, and support was requested from Teacher Li Wei and colleague Wang Fang. Team collaboration effectively alleviated the situation. In the future, team support mechanisms should be activated earlier in similar situations rather than handling them alone.  
Summary of Gains and Losses: Maintaining professional composure is fundamental, but the ability to "translate" communication effectively and the timing of seeking support are key areas for improvement.
summarized_info: I have created a note to review the conflict incident with the family during the outpatient visit on July 22. It documents my submission of an adverse event report and reflects on the gains and losses in communication methods, emotional management, and emergency handling.

title: First Independent Night Shift Record
content: January 8, 2025, first independent night shift in the cardiology department. Around 21:15, the on-duty nurse called for assistance as Patient Zhang in Bed 3 suddenly experienced dizziness and nausea. On-site blood pressure measurement showed a high reading of 192/112 mmHg. After urgently consulting Dr. Li Wei over the phone, measures such as administering sublingual antihypertensive medication, establishing an intravenous line, and initiating cardiac monitoring were carried out. Approximately 50 minutes later, the patient's blood pressure decreased, and symptoms were relieved. The entire process was intense but handled in an orderly manner, serving as a valuable experience in independently managing an emergency situation.

title: Heart Failure Case Study and Knowledge Integration
content:
【Learning Record 2025-03-13】

title: Afternoon Reading Reflection
content: During today's lunch break, I reread the chapter on "Medical Errors" in *Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance*, and it left a deep impression on me. Last Wednesday, a patient in bed three experienced an adverse reaction. Although we handled it promptly, upon reflection, there is still room for improvement in our procedures. It must be emphasized that: 1. System checks must be integrated into the order-entry process and should not rely solely on post-hoc verification; 2. Patient education needs to be personalized and cannot rely on a one-size-fits-all approach. The former is a rigid safeguard against errors, while the latter embodies compassionate care.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen recorded reflections after reading the chapter on medical errors in "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance," emphasizing the importance of pre-system checks and personalized patient education.

title: Reflections on Medical Record Documentation
content: The afternoon in the department was relatively quiet, allowing me to focus on refining the medical records for two key patients and completing a discharge summary. I kept the reading notes of *Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance* close at hand, constantly reminding myself of the importance of "rigor." When describing changes in the patients' conditions, physical examination findings, and treatment responses, I carefully weighed my words, repeatedly refining the phrasing to ensure objectivity, precision, and logical coherence. I paid particular attention to avoiding subjective assumptions, striving to ensure that every entry in the records was verifiable and evidence-based.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen documented her insights on repeatedly deliberating over word choices to ensure precision and logic when writing medical records, drawing from her reading notes of "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance."

title: Comparison of Medical English Course Platforms
content:
**Platform Comparative Analysis (Date: 2025-12-01)**
1. **Platform A (e.g., Coursera-like):** Features a systematic course syllabus with comprehensive English modules on pathophysiology. Instructors are university professors from abroad, offering high authority. Higher price, fixed schedule, requiring dedicated time blocks.
2. **Platform B (Domestic, focused on Medical English):** Core modules: Medical literature reading guidance and international conference presentation skills. Instructors are language experts with medical backgrounds. Moderate pricing, supports mobile learning for fragmented time, flexible schedule.
3. **Platform C:** Focuses on daily doctor-patient conversations, highly practical but lacks academic depth. Lowest price.
**Preliminary Conclusion:** Priority given to Platform B for its flexibility and targeted approach. A trial session is recommended for confirmation.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen created a comparative analysis note on different online medical English course platforms, detailing platform features, course outlines, faculty, and pricing.

title: Outpatient Communication Reflection and Colleague Suggestions
content:
July 23, 2025, afternoon. Discussed yesterday’s conflict with family members with colleagues at a café. Key takeaways from the conversation:  
1. When handling similar situations, the first step is not to explain but to address the other person’s emotions first, using the "empathy-confirmation-guidance" framework.  
2. Teacher Li shared his experience: when feeling emotions rising, use a small physical action (such as pressing your feet to the ground) to create a "pause," helping to shift your response mode.  
3. Sister Wang Fang reminded me not to over-blame myself afterward, but to record specific reflection points and turn them into actionable guidelines.  
Key insight: Maintaining professionalism doesn’t mean having no emotions, but rather not letting emotions drive your actions.
summarized_info: I have documented the key points from this afternoon's discussion with colleagues at the café, where we reviewed yesterday's doctor-patient conflict. This includes the communication framework, emotional management techniques, and mindset adjustment suggestions.

title: Notes and Reflections from the First Day of the Annual Conference
content:
November 2, 2025, Shanghai  
The presentations at the main venue during the day were packed with information. Professor Li’s sharing was quite enlightening, but the all-English presentation by the American expert in the afternoon was quite challenging to follow. I struggled with many technical terms and long sentences, so I kept taking photos of the slides, afraid of missing key points. While organizing the photos and notes in the evening, I realized that I still only partially understood several slides of English content and had to look up each word one by one. It seems that both listening and reading skills urgently need improvement, especially vocabulary and expressions in professional fields. There’s another English workshop tomorrow—let’s keep pushing forward.

title: Flexible Exercise Program
content:
February Exercise Summary & March Plan:
The original plan of going to the gym three times a week at fixed times proved difficult to execute, often interrupted by overtime work or low energy levels, leading to a sense of frustration.  
【Core of the New Plan】: Flexible formats and adaptable scheduling.  
1. Alternate activity formats: Aim for 3–4 exercise sessions per week, with no restrictions on the format (gym workouts, jogging, home-based follow-along sessions, or weekend hiking are all acceptable).  
2. Build in flexibility: No fixed dates required, as long as the target number of sessions is completed within the week; adjust the duration of each session from a fixed 1 hour to 30–60 minutes, depending on daily energy levels.  
3. Tracking method: Only log completed sessions in the health app, without creating detailed schedules, to reduce mental burden.  
Goal: Make exercise serve as a means to restore energy, rather than becoming a source of stress.
summarized_info: I recorded reflections and adjustments to the exercise plan, with the new approach emphasizing alternating activity forms and allowing for flexibility.

content: I had lunch with Wang Fang and Liu Qiang in the cafeteria at noon, and we discussed the hospital union's hiking activity. It was decided that Wang Fang and I would participate together, and we agreed that I would be responsible for the online registration. Wang Fang will provide her personal information to me.
summarized_info: Recorded a discussion with colleagues during lunch about the mountain climbing activity and confirmed the registration arrangements.

title: Postscript to the Kaifeng Trip
content: After organizing the photos and finishing the diary, I realized this short trip was truly therapeutic. It completely cleared my mind, and I feel like I’ve stored up enough energy to last for quite a while. Just looking at the photos makes me smile. This kind of simple, small happiness is so worth having. Now I’m starting to think about where to go next—I want to experience this kind of relaxation and joy again.
summarized_info: In her notes, Yu Xiaowen recorded her feelings after traveling to Kaifeng, believing that the trip was healing and relaxing, bringing small moments of happiness and sparking a desire to embark on similar journeys again.

title: Key Points for the Farewell Conversation with Teacher Li
content: April 26, 2025, Hospital Rest Area, the Last Long Conversation Before Teacher Li's Departure. Teacher Li particularly affirmed my recent progress, especially the calmness I demonstrated when handling cases independently. He advised me to be more confident in the future, not to fear, and to bravely take on responsibilities and make decisions independently, while maintaining this grounded attitude and passion for learning. I have benefited greatly and need to digest and apply these lessons well.
summarized_info: I have documented the key points of an important conversation, which involves encouragement and instructions regarding the ability to handle cases independently.

title: Recent Stress Symptoms and Triggers
content: Recently, I have been experiencing persistent anxiety, insomnia, and low energy. Possible triggers include: 1. Unstable living conditions, as the landlord may reclaim the house early, requiring me to find a new place as soon as possible (housing crisis). 2. A heavy workload at work, high expectations from superiors, and tense relationships with colleagues, often leaving me feeling physically and mentally exhausted (work pressure). 3. Preparing for the year-end professional title exam, with my review progress severely lagging, causing significant anxiety (professional title exam preparation). I need to seek ways to alleviate these issues.
summarized_info: The current symptoms of anxiety and insomnia have been documented, along with the three major stress triggers: housing crisis, work pressure, and preparation for professional title examinations.

title: Notes After Calling Mom and Dad
content: I video-called my parents for almost half an hour in the evening. They kept reminding me to take care of my health, not to overwork myself, and to eat and sleep on time. I told them that work has been a bit tiring lately, but I didn’t mention any specific troubles. They repeatedly emphasized that health comes first and that they would feel at ease as long as I stay healthy. Listening to their nagging made me feel much more grounded and warm inside. Knowing that they are both in good health also put my mind at ease. I didn’t bring up the topics of finding a new place or my upcoming exams this time—I didn’t want them to worry any more.
summarized_info: This records the feelings after video chatting with my parents the previous night. It mentions that my parents mainly cared about her health and reminded her to rest, which made her feel warm and secure. However, specific issues such as finding a house (housing crisis) or exams (reviewing for the professional title exam) were not discussed during the call.

title: Preliminary Plan for Bonus Distribution
content: Last week, I had a meeting with financial advisor Wang Mingyuan, where we preliminarily discussed the allocation approach for the annual performance bonus. He suggested dividing the bonus proportionally for different investment goals, with specific details to be determined later.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen recorded the preliminary ideas for bonus distribution discussed with financial advisor Wang Mingyuan.

title: Reflection on Ceramic Art Creation
content: The pottery piece I fired today was a complete failure, with multiple cracks and uneven, dull glaze. I'm feeling extremely disheartened, as if all my efforts have gone to waste. I might need to adjust the clay mixture and firing temperature, but I simply don't have the energy to deal with it anytime soon.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen documented the feelings of frustration and reflections on craftsmanship after the pottery piece failed during the firing process.

title: 11.08 Summary of Medical English Learning
content: Today, I completed video learning, focusing on the pronunciation and usage of professional terminology. I engaged in extensive shadowing exercises and compiled English expressions for terms related to heart failure, along with their applications in clinical contexts. Some difficult words have been added to my vocabulary notebook.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen documented a summary of her medical English study, mentioning shadowing exercises and terminology organization.

title: Family Affairs Reminder
content: While watering the pothos and snake plants at home this morning, I felt the living room was a bit empty and thought about buying more green plants for decoration. I'll focus on varieties that are easy to care for and can purify the air. I'll look into it this week.
summarized_info: While watering the green plants in the morning, Yu Xiaowen came up with the idea of purchasing more low-maintenance plants to decorate the living room and noted it down in her memo.

content: Evening Deep Dive: 1. Target Plants: Fiddle Leaf Fig (good shape), Monstera (easy to care for, shade-tolerant), Bird of Paradise (large, suitable for living room corners). 2. Sketched a layout for placing a large Bird of Paradise in the southeast corner of the living room (saved as an image), paired with a small trolley plant stand. Planning to visit the local flower market this weekend to see the plants in person.

title: Evening Study and Career Planning
content: On the evening of June 20, 2025, I used a personal laptop to access and compare multiple training platforms for the attending physician examination via a web browser. The focus was on course content, faculty, and pricing. I am initially inclined toward the comprehensive course package offered by the Medical Education Network.

title: Thoughts on the Use of Bonuses
content: The bonus has been credited and allocated. It has been promptly communicated to the financial advisor, Li Wei. A portion of the funds has been set aside for personal interest development, with plans to enroll in the advanced pottery and sculpting class taught by Teacher Zheng. Additionally, arrangements need to be made with Wang Fang and Sun Yue for a weekend exhibition visit.

title: Review of the First Medical English Class with a Foreign Teacher
content: The first video lesson with foreign teacher John ended on the evening of December 5th. Despite thorough preparation, I still felt nervous during the actual conversation, leading to pauses and inappropriate word choices. The teacher was very patient. The lesson recording has been saved. From enrolling in this course focused on academic and professional medicine at the beginning of the month to the first practical session, the interval felt neither too long nor too short, allowing me ample time to prepare. More practice is needed to overcome nervousness.
summarized_info: Recorded the feelings and reflections after the first medical English class taught by a foreign instructor, indirectly mentioning the relationship between enrollment and class timing.

title: Record of Happy Friends Communication
content: Discussing the specific arrangements for next week's concert with Lin Feng in the WeChat group. He reminded me to select seats, and I have already made the payment. The concert features a large-scale symphony, with the program including works by Beethoven.
summarized_info: Recorded a discussion with Lin Feng regarding concert arrangements, mentioning Beethoven's works.

title: Housework and Watering Flowers Rehearsal
content: I did a simple cleaning of the living room in the evening. When I saw the old flowerpot on the balcony, a sudden idea came to mind, so I added a little water to slightly moisten the soil. Following the plan I made five days ago, I’ll go to the flower market this weekend to buy some new plants to put in it. The room should feel more lively then.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen noted down the tasks of cleaning the living room in the evening and rehearsing watering the old flowerpots on the balcony, and mentioned preparing to purchase new green plants as planned over the weekend.

content:
I. Today's Attempts:

title: Daily Summary
content: October 25th: Hiking during the day, and after the evening care session, I had a video call with Jingjing, sharing funny stories and photos from the hike. She listened happily.

title: Reflections on Reading Before Sleep
content: Reading "When Breath Becomes Air," the book emphasizes that medicine is not just about technology, but should also encompass the exploration of the meaning of life and humanistic care. While treating diseases, the overall human experience must not be overlooked.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen recorded her reflections on the concept of medical humanities after reading "When Breath Becomes Air."

title: Health Manual Design Notes
content: Creating a health handbook for parents, incorporating a 'Life Wisdom Record Page for Elders.' Inspired by a book I recently read, the aim is to blend medical guidelines with humanistic reflections, making the handbook more heartfelt and focused on life rather than just illness.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen designed the humanities section of the health manual, drawing inspiration from concepts gained through reading.

title: Health Plan Updates and Review
content: October 18, 2025 Exercise Record: Completed a 30-minute gentle morning walk. Participated in an archery experience class in the afternoon and found it very suitable for me. Decided to incorporate archery into my weekly regular exercise routine starting next week, with training scheduled every Wednesday afternoon. This is a continued effort in advancing the health adjustment plan from May 22.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen recorded the sports activities for October 18, 2025 in her notes and updated the health plan to include archery as a regular exercise.

title: The idea of creating a 'Healing Focus' collection
content: I was just listening to Schubert's piano music while having dinner at home, and the sense of tranquility was absolutely wonderful. It suddenly occurred to me that I should gather all such music that can soothe anxiety and bring peace into a dedicated collection. I'll put it on NetEase Cloud Music and name it 'Healing Focus'.
summarized_info: In her notes, Yu Xiaowen documented her idea of creating a 'Healing Focus' music playlist, inspired by the sense of tranquility she felt while listening to Schubert's piano piece during dinner.

title: Light Food Journey Record
content: In the morning, I had a call with Jingjing and shared the positive feelings brought by my recent habit of eating light meals. Reflecting on this process, since the first time I ordered a salad for takeout, my physical condition has indeed improved, and I hope to continue sticking with it.
summarized_info: I documented the experience of sharing light meal tips with my best friend and reflected on the beginning of this habit.

title: Reading Discussion Reflection
content: This noon, I discussed the book "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance" with Wang Fang at the hospital cafeteria. She shared her perspective on deliberate practice, and I found it very enlightening when combined with the details from my morning ward rounds. The atmosphere of our conversation was excellent.
summarized_info: I have documented the reflections and insights from my discussion with Wang Fang about "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance."

title: Post-game Notes and Reflections
content: 2025.04.13 Recalling the night before last (probably the night of the 11th), I stayed up until almost 1 a.m. for the new chapter of "Legend of Illusion" without even realizing it. It was the first time I stayed up so late for a game. Although I was a bit tired, the storyline and level design were truly brilliant, making it worth noting. I should try to manage my time a bit better in the future.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowen reflected in her notes on the experience of staying up late playing games a few days ago, mentioning that it was the first time.

content: Friday, February 28, 2025, marks the department's first team-building escape room activity, to be held at the "Mystery City" themed venue. Afterward, everyone will gather for dinner at a location that has already been arranged, with Wang Fang in charge of reserving the spot. Looking forward to having fun together!

content: Yesterday, I attended a salon for appreciating Beethoven's piano sonatas. It was my first time participating in a classical music appreciation event, and I was deeply impressed by the "Moonlight" Sonata. I also exchanged thoughts with fellow book club members.

content: On the evening of January 24, 2025, I attended the 'City Corner' music salon for the first time. The atmosphere was fantastic, and I met some new friends. This type of offline event is quite interesting, and I plan to participate more often in the future.
